# [About MSCA Staff Exchanges](https://marie-sklodowska-curie-actions.ec.europa.eu/calls/msca-staff-exchanges-2024)

The MSCA Staff Exchanges program supports short-term international and cross-sector exchanges for staff involved in research and innovation. Its goal is to build lasting collaboration between academic and non-academic sectors across Europe and beyond, especially small and medium-sized enterprises (SMEs). The program helps participants enhance their knowledge, skills, and career development while boosting the research and innovation capacities of their organizations.

## Funding details:

Projects can last up to 4 years, equivalent to 360 person-months.
Projects involve partners from 
academia (university or research institute)
NGOs (public health organizations or environmental advocacy groups)
Private sector organization (industry, business, small or medium-sized enterprise)
Public sector organization (national, regional, or local government, agency, or museum)
Each participating organization can use the project to fund the secondments of their staff in the other organizations participating in the project:
researchers at any career stage, from PhD candidates to postdoctoral researchers, as well as administrative, technical or managerial staff involved in research and innovation activities;
of any nationality;
must be engaged in, or linked to, research and innovation activities at their sending organization for at least one month before the secondment;
should return to their sending organization after the secondment to pass on their knowledge and foster collaboration.
Secondment requirements:
The minimum length of the secondment is one month.
The mobility of individual staff members can range from 1 to 12 months.
Secondments can be split across multiple institutions and periods.
Exchanges between EU member states or associated countries must be cross-sectoral unless they are interdisciplinary.
Exchanges with non-associated third countries can remain within the same sector or discipline.
Monthly allowance per person-month: €5,010
Staff allowance: €2,710 gross (country-specific taxes might apply)
Organization costs: €2,300
Bench fee for the hosting institution (research, training, networking): €1,300
Management & indirect costs: €1,000
The special needs allowance applies only to staff members with disabilities.
There is no additional allowance for traveling with families.

# Rules of the exchange program

Researchers and administrative, technical, and managerial staff involved in research and innovation within the project can participate in MSCA Staff Exchanges. To be eligible, they must have worked on these activities at their home institution for at least one full-time month before their first secondment. After the secondment, participants are expected to return to their home organization to share what they’ve learned. Each participant can spend up to 12 months in secondments, split across multiple institutions and periods.
